column3:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#15483](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/15483.html) (rpc: Adding a 'logpath' entry to getrpcinfo
Is this good to merge, or is anything left for me to do?
So we are testing that this unexpected situation does not occur by means of Python throwing an error otherwise. :)\n\nGood catch, fixed!
You could move this to `test/functional/test_framework/util.py` or even try to extend `assert_raises_rpc_error`?

I'm not sure if that makes sense - checking the HTTP status code is a rather specific thing, which I don't expect us to do outside of this one test.  Thus I think it makes sense to keep the code here.\n\nBut if you disagree and see us checking status codes in other tests as well, I'm happy to move this to a more general place.
Ok, it can be moved if needed.

Yeah, that's what I think is best.  (But if anyone else feels like we should have this general right away, let me know and I will extend `assert_raises_rpc_error` to optionally check the HTTP status.)
